search_results.snippet:
Philadelphia is a 1993 American drama film and one of the first mainstream 
Hollywood films to acknowledge HIV/AIDS, homosexuality, and homophobia. It 
was written by Ron Nyswaner, directed by Jonathan Demme and stars Tom 
Hanks and Denzel Washington.
